image.altText: Hands holding a jar of pills.

props.synopsis: Australia's medicines regulator says its laws have failed to slow a growing number of people with blood toxicity attributed to a common over-the-counter vitamin.

title.children: 'Shocking' increase in vitamin B6 toxicity cases

image.altText: Three men, Sean Combs, Justin Bieber and Rick Ross, stand together.

props.synopsis: Violence, music, money, a meteoric rise and a faster fall. Sean 'Diddy' Combs had it all until his life and crimes brought him back to the boroughs of New York City for a sordid court case.

title.children: Bad Boy Inc, White Parties and sex trafficking charges. The Diddy story

image.altText: Melissa McIntosh gestures with her hand, pointing up, while holding a microphone. Behind her is a Liberal party logo.

props.synopsis: The Coalition's new shadow minister for women, Melissa McIntosh, has called for a cultural overhaul of the Liberal Party.

title.children: Shadow minister for women calls for systemic party change beyond quotas

image.altText: Brett Button wearing a suit and tie and glasses walks in to court.

props.synopsis: Brett Andrew Button will argue in court his sentence for a crash that killed 10 people was "manifestly excessive" and the sentencing judge "erred" on two findings.

title.children: Hunter Valley bus crash driver appeals 32-year sentence

image.altText: A head-and-shoulders shot of Eileen Bond dressed in black at Alan Bond's funeral.

props.synopsis: Ms Bond died last night at the age of 87 and her son remembers her as a great mother who "lived life to the fullest".

title.children: Eileen Bond, ex-wife of controversial businessman Alan Bond, dies

image.altText: A silhouette of a woman's head and shoulders.

props.synopsis: Parents of potential victims of alleged child sex offender Joshua Dale Brown speak of their horror at finding out their children could have been abused or contracted STIs.

title.children: 'Seemed quite friendly': Parents of potential victims of alleged childcare abuser speak

image.altText: Rescuers on a boat in the water at night

props.synopsis: The KMP Tunu Pratama Jaya sank almost half an hour after leaving East Java's Ketapang port late on Wednesday, bound for Bali's Gilimanuk port, the National Search and Rescue Agency said in a statement.

title.children: Rescuers search for 38 people after Bali ferry sinking leaves at least four dead

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Meanwhile, the fall-out from the Qantas cyber attack continues. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Wall Street rises on US-Vietnam trade deal, while ASX miners up on oil surge

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Qantas starts telling customers their data was taken
Microsoft to lay off about 4pc of workforce
Reports of a tariff deal between US and Vietnam

image.altText: Qantas Departure sign outside airport terminal

props.synopsis: Cybersecurity experts are warning Qantas customers to remain vigilant to scams and hacking attempts in coming days, after as many as 6 million Australians were caught up in a data breach. Here's what we know about the data stolen, how it could be used and what you can do to protect yourself.

title.children: What the Qantas cyber attack could mean for your personal data

image.altText: Thousands of people gathered at the foot of Parliament House in Melbourne.

props.synopsis: The final report by Australia's first truth-telling commission was tabled in parliament this week. What does this mean for Australia, and will it lead to change?

title.children: 'We can’t allow this opportunity to slip': Calls to act on Yoorrook

image.altText: A large dam in a regional area with water spilling over a reservoir on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: Severe weather warnings have been downgraded but emergency services warn damaging winds will linger around the NSW coast today.

title.children: Warnings remain for NSW coast, Warragamba Dam spills

image.altText: A close up of a man wearing a suit speaking.

props.synopsis: Reforms that would standardise Working with Children Checks across the country "can't happen soon enough", the federal education minister says, in the wake of allegations of child sexual abuse at a Victorian childcare centre.

title.children: 'It's taken too long': Minister criticises Working with Children Check reforms

image.altText: The entrance to Mooropna Primary School.

props.synopsis: A primary school in northern Victoria informs parents that police have charged one of its staff members with possession of child abuse material.

title.children: Victorian school staff member facing child abuse material charge

image.altText: Britain's Catherine, Princess of Wales mid laugh during a close up interview in a beige top

props.synopsis: Catherine, the Princess of Wales, discusses her experience undergoing chemotherapy and resuming life afterwards during a visit to an English hospital.

title.children: Princess Catherine reveals more details of cancer experience during hospital visit

image.altText: A photo of Patricia McGarry outside her home

props.synopsis: After falling behind on mortgage repayments, this home owner says she often forgoes meals to feed her cats. Recent data shows she's not alone.

title.children: Woman who finally bought her own home at age 60 faces losing it all

image.altText: Max Verstappen walking down the pit lane in Austria, in his racing suit and cap

props.synopsis: Formula 1 world champion Max Verstappen is the centre of attention ahead of this weekend's British Grand Prix as rumours intensify that he could leave Red Bull Racing at the end of the season.

title.children: Verstappen's F1 future uncertain with rumours he will leave Red Bull

image.altText: A black and white image with stars

props.synopsis: Astronomers have discovered a new object that originated outside of our Solar System — only the third to be found.

title.children: New interstellar 'comet' discovered speeding through our Solar System

image.altText: A close up of people wearing leather sandals on the runway

props.synopsis: At Milan Fashion Week, models strutted in Prada's new line of open-toe leather sandals. Thousands of kilometres away in India, the show was met with disbelief.

title.children: Prada accused of copying Indian fashion with new $1,200 sandals

image.altText: President Donald Trump speaks to the media, Friday, June 27, 2025, in the briefing room of the White House in Washington.

props.synopsis: Media group Paramount will pay Donald Trump more than $24 million to settle a lawsuit filed over an interview with former US presidential rival Kamala Harris.

title.children: Paramount to pay Trump $24m over Harris interview lawsuit

image.altText: Jacqui in car

props.synopsis: Jacqui Purton died after being hit by a car driven by her ex-partner at a property north-east of Hobart in March 2023.

title.children: Breaking: Man who ran car over Tasmanian mum sentenced to 13 years' jail

image.altText: Man with rainbow hair wearing rainbow clothes steps into a rainbow party bus.

props.synopsis: There have been 23 courtroom places for the public in the Erin Patterson triple-murder trial. Competition for those seats starts early each morning.

title.children: People turning down work shifts to spend months at the mushroom trial

image.altText: A woman smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: A coastal town will host a WA tourism conference next year, but some local businesses are not sure they will still be operating due to a decline in visitors.

title.children: Businesses pay the price as tourists bypass WA coastal town

image.altText: A man in a green hoodie sits on a brick wall holding a sign.

props.synopsis: The banking sector is rolling out a new system intended to combat scam losses by telling customers when a payment recipient's name does not match other account details.

title.children: Scam victim loses home deposit to a security flaw that banks are now targeting

image.altText: Close up of man wearing glasses

props.synopsis: Joshua Maxwell was told his open-heart surgery had to be done within 90 days. He thought he was going to die as the wait extended beyond 200 days.

title.children: Patient at troubled hospital waited 210 days for life-saving surgery

image.altText: Australian Dollar coins and notes are placed on a receipt

props.synopsis: Experts say that using AI for taxes is convenient, but it also carries risks, especially when relying heavily on the technology. Here's what taxpayers should know.

title.children: Should you use AI to calculate your tax return? Here's what to know

image.altText: A fiddler ray with reddish tinges

props.synopsis: Dozens of sharks and rays collected from Adelaide beaches will be studied to find out how they were killed by the algal bloom amid fears of future local extinctions.

title.children: Adelaide residents rally to collect deluge of dead marine life from algal bloom

image.altText: The top of UTS Tower visible over red corrugated rooves of a warehouse.

props.synopsis: The University of Technology Sydney is being investigated by SafeWork over "psychological hazards" arising from a restructure with other universities also wielding the axe.

title.children: 'Helplessness and uncertainty': UTS staff risk jobs to raise concerns over $100m restructure

image.altText: Jordan Thompson preparing to hit a backhand shot on a grass tennis court

props.synopsis: Australian Jordan Thompson comes from behind to win a gruelling five-set match for the second time at Wimbledon this week.

title.children: Thompson wins another thriller, Aussie comedian shares crowd altercation

image.altText: Tiered brick pyramid in sandy desert with line of people walking up to it.

props.synopsis: Researchers have sequenced the genome of an ancient Egyptian who was buried in a pot nearly 5,000 years ago, about the time some of the oldest, and most famous, pyramids were built.

title.children: DNA from skeleton in a pot reveals ancient Egyptian's ancestry

image.altText: a boy pours water over his head during a heatwave at the spanish steps in Rome

props.synopsis: Four people have died in Spain, two in France and two in Italy as an early summer heatwave continues to grip much of Europe.

title.children: At least eight dead as heatwave in Europe closes nuclear reactor and fans fires

image.altText: GettyImages-2223282749

props.synopsis: Carlos Alcaraz, Emma Raducanu, Aryna Sabalenka and the end of London's tropical heatwave see a sense of normality return to the lawns of Wimbledon on day three.

title.children: Normality returns to Wimbledon as heavyweights win on day three

image.altText: A man celebrates after scoring a try in an NRL match

props.synopsis: After putting the journey into journeyman, Gehamat Shibasaki will become one of Queensland's most unlikely Origin debutants and his long road to the decider has taken him right back to where he started.

title.children: How Origin's most unlikely debutant ended up exactly where he's meant to be

image.altText: Bec Nolan with her husband and her three kids on the beach

props.synopsis: The mental load of juggling three young kids, while running a household with a husband who works long hours, and now caring for her mum with dementia, is "relentless", says Bec Nolan.

title.children: Bec is part of the 'sandwich generation'. She says it's relentless
